data.title: One word:  ROACHES
data.text: This place is full of the little critters.  Went to the restroom upon arrival.  Light was off.  Turned on light and they scattered.  Sat down at table and there was one on the wall.  Didn't eat there and immediately left.

data.title: Dinner with friends
data.text: Don't even waste your time with this place. A group of 4 of us walked in for dinner at 5:30, and we were the only customers in the place. We ordered basic Italian plates like chicken part and pasta. I asked the waitress for penne with my plate and instead was given spaghetti. When asked for a plate of penne and marinara, she came back with a plate of plain pasta. So....I asked for the marinara, and she came back with a bowl of cold sauce! The chicken parm basically looked like frozen fried chicken strips defrosted and cut up and placed on top of the dish. When the waitress handed me my extremely hot plate, she failed to mention it and burned my finger. Service and food was terrible!

data.title: Okay food
data.text: The pizza was okay, got  2 meat pizza's.  Only had like 2 pieces of sausage on each pie.  Kinda skimpy, the crust was good though as was the sauce.  Got two chef salads with ranch dressing, well they didnt put the ranch in the order at all, they were very skimpy on the vegatables.  seems like a theme on getting what you pay for.  Price was okay but for what you get???? MEH.  I would maybe give them another try.

data.title: Great thin crust pizza
data.text: We ate the thin crust pizza two nights during our stay in Nashville. Great tasting pizza.  Finding great pizza outside of NYC is not always easy.  This place is doing it right.

data.title: Late night delivery
data.text: I called and ordered delivery a hair after midnight.  They said they would deliver in about 35 minutes and they were there early.  I asked for a double pepperoni and honestly I think I just got the regular amount.  But you know, late night pizza is great.  They delivered me a good pizza sooner than quoted.  Good option.

data.title: Average pizza…good late night option
data.text: Got this pizza to take back to the hotel after a night of hockey and bar-hopping.  Service was okay and the pizza was pretty good.

data.title: Good pizza......
data.text: The pizza was good.  We also had the appetizers which were good but not outstanding.  Service was a little slow-waitress indifferent.

data.title: Great food - Sketchy dining area
data.text: Had pizza, salads, and calzone.  All were excellent.  Dining area was dingy, dark, and questionable regarding cleanliness.  After seeing cockroach crawl across floor and seeing dirt on table cloths, we decided to do "take out".

data.title: "You won't forget it. "
data.text:
We stopped at Caesar's on the way to a Nashville Sounds game,  and I'm so glad we did.  It was our second time to visit. 

The waiter asked if we had tried the calzones.  We told him we hadn't.  He explained they are handmade with the finest ingredients, are big enough to share,  and added, "You won't forget it."

We ordered a 12" calzone to share.   Oh, my word.   It was delicious and so was the marinara sauce for dipping.  I'm already contemplating when I can go back.

It is not a fancy place, but if you are looking for a quiet restaurant downtown with reasonable prices and unforgettable calzones, Caesar's is the ticket.

data.title: Just ok- recommend adding something about Nashville
data.text: This spot is close to the Capitol and Veterans park. Open at acceptable hours, safe and friendly. Food bland: The Pizza was moist, not crispy.

data.title: Order from Caesar's - You won't Regret It!
data.text: Caesar’s Pizza was warm and tasty, and it was nice to get pizza from a place that I don’t have back home.  The crust was soft and the perfect amount of doughy.  The ratio of sauce, spices, cheese and toppings (pepperoni and mushrooms) was done well.  Nothing was too overwhelming.  The really amazing parts of their pizza, is their pepperoni tasted like it was freshly made and they delivered right to my hotel door.  They were very good about speed as well even thought it was prime time for late night deliveries.  Now I only wish we had a Caesar’s where I live, although, that could get dangerous with those late delivery hours.

data.title: Great Place
data.text: We only found this place because someone slipped a brochure under our hotel room door.  I'm so glad they did!  After going downtown to hang out and listen to some live music ... bad decision.  All those places were packed (basketball tournament in town) and there was just no way to get in much less sit down to eat anything! We headed back to the hotel to hopefully find something less crowded ... everything between Broadway and our hotel  was closed ... even the Quiznos across the street was closed!  All the hotels in that area and Quiznos didn't keep enough business to stay open on a Saturday night? We went back to our room defeated and saw the trifold. Glad we didn't toss it out.  So we started walking.  What a find! I ordered the cheese ravioli and hubby ordered the Caesar 10" pizza.  He felt his pizza was okay.  I thought my ravioli was absolutely delicious and served piping hot.  The service was a little slow for the number of people in there (not many) but the food was worth the wait. We noticed that a steady stream of people were coming in ... there were a number of empty tables but every time someone left, another couple or group came in.  I would most definitely eat here again.

data.title: Late Night Option but AWFUL
data.text: After a late night concert this restaurant was recommended by the hotel staff.  Bad deal.  Ordered and they failed to match price stated in their window when I went to pay.  Pizza was not edible, even when starving.  Pass on this fine Italian eatery in downtown Nashville and wait for Dominos (and that in itself is not much of an option).

data.title: Few places open at night downtown
data.text: For what it was, Caesar's was good!  Decent pizza for downtown Nashville.  And one of the few places open (at all) on a Friday night.

data.title: Giving a 2 we all had the cheeseburger combo
data.text: The burger patty was disgusting! Dont order it. Now that I think about it we should of had Italian food. Maybe it would have been better. They also turned on pop music juat after we seated that we thought was to loud and kind of annoying! The steak fries are pretty good though.

data.title: Decent pasta - fast service
data.text: Went here to get a quick pre-race pasta meal before the Nashville Half Marathon. Service was very fast and food was plentiful and inexpensive. Pasta and sauce was decent - not fantastic, but cheap and cheery and served my purposes. Looked like they had good pizza.

data.title: Off the beaten path
data.text: I ordered a "small" 'create your own' calzone. It was done perfectly and MORE than enough for 1 person. I've also had their Apple Chicken Salad. It was really good. The chicken was moist and flavorful and the lettuce was crisp. The value is really good - more food than you expect. They'll also make substitutions without any additional charge! The restaurant is reasonably clean, but sits off of an alley which doesn't smell too good. The staff is friendly and there is plenty of seating.

data.title: Good Pizza
data.text: A quick business lunch before traveling. It's on 6th Avenue in Downtown Nashville.   I had the cheese pizza. The crust was flavorful.  I enjoyed it. Customer service was great!

data.title: Best pizza ever!
data.text: Yes, it was well after midnight. Yes, we had a bit too much to drink after a night on Broadway and felt like we had never eaten before. And yes, Caesar's was the only place open near our hotel, but my god, their BBQ Chicken and Bacon pizza will go down in my memory as the best pizza ever! If you are lucky enough to be near it, go and get one…you will not be disappointed!

data.title: Super fast and good
data.text: Got in to our hotel at 1 am, the lobby gave us the menu to this place. We literally got our pizza in 15 minutes!! And the pizza was good!! Will call again!!
